channel.title: Gcc on Bits of Insight
channel.description: Recent content in Gcc on Bits of Insight

item.title: Useful GCC options
item.description: Here are some of the useful, but not widely known, options of GCC that I want to document. gcc -dumpspecs Gives the specifications with which GCC was built. gcc -fstack-usage Gives the stack usage function-wise for the compiled translation unit; this is helpful in measuring runtime memory usage. See the manual for details on deciphering its output. # get macros defined when the language is C++ cpp -xc++ -dM /dev/null # get macros defined when the language is C cpp -dM /dev/null Prints the macros defined when the preprocessor was called.
